title: Baltic Birch Sheets
description: 4x 18mm 5x5' Baltic Birch @ 135.57

title: Whitewash Test
description: Test 'Nordic White' Precolor + 'Super White' Part A on scraps.

title: Bending Jig
description: Cut out two matching template pieces out of 3/4" MDF. Includes alignment slots.

title: Bending Jig Assembly
description: Cut alignment blocks and attach to templates.

title: Frame Piece Breakdown
description: Rough breakdown of 4x frame pieces along the grain to allow kerf bending.

title: Panel Breakdown
description: Rough breakdown + labelling of of remaining panels into pieces that can be further sized on the "MFT" table.

title: Finalize Width of Frames
description: Cut frame pieces to final width of 415mm + parallel sides.

title: Finalize Frames
description: Square up one remaining side of frames then cut to 798mm.

title: Kerf Bending Test
description: Test kerf bending parameters on off cuts from frames.

title: Frame Kerf Cuts
description: Mark, set up, and cut all the kerfs in 4x frame pieces.

title: Bending Jig Details
description: Add clear tape to bending jig edges & attach clamping and alignment blocks

title: Frame Bending 1
description: Wet the outside of the kerf bend & add glue using a syringe. Bend frame over jig and attach with clamps. Leave to cure for >24h.

title: Frame Bending 2
description: Wet the outside of the kerf bend & add glue using a syringe. Bend frame over jig and attach with clamps. Leave to cure for >24h.

title: Frame Bending 3
description: Wet the outside of the kerf bend & add glue using a syringe. Bend frame over jig and attach with clamps. Leave to cure for >24h.

title: Frame Bending 2
description: Wet the outside of the kerf bend & add glue using a syringe. Bend frame over jig and attach with clamps. Leave to cure for >24h.

title: Inside Kerf Bend Sanding
description: Using a flap wheel, sand the inside of the kerf bends to remove all the excess glue and smooth out the surface on all frames.

title: Final Dimensioning of Frames
description: Placing the frame pieces against a reference surface (wall, bench), mark the correct measurements and trim with a track saw.

title: Frame Joinery
description: Cut Domino (6x40mm) mortises in the short ends of the frames to connect each pairs together.

title: Frame Joinery 2
description: Cut Domino connector mortises in the short ends of the frames to connect each pairs together.

title: Frame Assembly
description: Insert all dominos and connector hardware, add glue, assemble, and tighten connectors.

title: Final Dimensioning of Sides & Tops
description: Using the final measurements from the frames, cut all side and top pieces to that width.

title: Final Dimensioning of Sides
description: Sneak up on the correct dimension to cut the sides to the correct height so the frames are parallel on either side.

title: Final Dimensioning of Frames & Tops
description: Using a tall stop block cut the frames to the same final width on top and bottom. Use that same setup to cut the tops to width.

title: Rubio Monocoat
description: Super White - 350ml

title: Formica Laminate
description: 2x 4x8' Mission White @ 68.80

title: Piece selection
description: Compare all tops and sides and keep the most consistent ones. Enough for one less middle module.

title: Module assembly
description: Using glue, pin nails, and screws: assemble the three modules. Plane down any lips at the joints.

title: Module rabbet
description: Using a rabbeting bit at a router table, cut a 1/4" rabbet along the back of all the modules.

title: Module inside sanding
description: Sand the inside of each module to 120 grit. Then take internal measurements for the back panels.

title: Backs
description: Cut back panels to size and start rounding the corners. Refine the radius with a sander for an exact fit.

title: Backs
description: Finish rounding large end radius and hand-fit each back with a sander and handplane.

title: Backs
description: Finish rounding last back.

title: Edge Banding Strips
description: Cut 10mm strips of 4/4 material enough to cover all the case edges. Also cut the same thickness of 8/4 material to edge band the corners.

title: Case Edge Banding
description: Cut edge banding material to length and apply to shelves and one of the end cases.

title: Case Edge Banding
description: Cut edge banding material to length and apply to the second end case.
